Vietnamese Braised Short Ribs Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDVietnamese Braised Short RibsSponsored by Campbell'sFacebookPinterestTwitterEmail6 - 8 servingsActive Time: 45 minTotal Time: 225 minBraised in Swanson Beef Stock, get the global flavor of your favorite pho without leaving the comfort of home.PrintIngredients2 tablespoons safflower oil5 pounds short ribs, (about 12 pieces)Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper9 garlic cloves, lightly crushed and peeled1 large vidalia onion, coarsely chopped, (12 ounces)4 cups Swanson Beef Stock2 cups red wine, like cabernet sauvignon3/4 cup unseasoned rice wine vinegar1/3 cup honey5 whole star anise1 cinnamon stick3 whole cloves2 ounces fresh ginger, sliced, (about 4 inches)2 tsp. fish sauce2 carrots, peeled into ribbons, (about 2 cups)4 radishes, very thinly sliced, (about 1 cup)2 teaspoons sugarSteamed jasmine rice, for servingRecipe PreparationPreheat oven to 325. In a large dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high. Season short ribs with salt and pepper and cook in batches until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer ribs to a plate and leave oil in pot.Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic and onion and cook, stirring frequently, until golden, about 10 minutes. Pour broth, wine, vinegar, and honey into pot and add star anise, cinnamon, clove, and ginger. Stir to combine.Meanwhile, toss carrots and radish with vinegar and sugar. Season with salt. Refrigerate.Return meat to pot. Cover, and transfer to oven. Cook until ribs are fork tender, about 3 hours.Using tongs or a slotted spoon, transfer short ribs to a plate. Set a fine sieve over a medium bowl and strain sauce. Skim fat from top; discard. Pour sauce back into pot and place over medium. Cook until the sauce thickens, about 10 minutes.
